reviews.productTitle: Enbrighten Almond Z-Wave Plus Smart Light Switch with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, Toggle, 14293
reviews.text: Excellent but only if you are able to install it. Easy with Smart Things (which Alexa will automatically recognize). Extremely tricky trying to connect to Ring Alarm. I finally managed to do it but I need to document how I did it because it was mostly accidental. With this switch installed with Ring Alarm, you can have an alarm, light, connect to wifi devices through Alexa etc. This is a big deal. Just remember this thing is ZWave (needed to connect to Ring Alarm) and it is a switch, not a dimmer. You want a switch that opens and closes with a relay.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2025
reviews.title: Excellent if you are able to and have the patience to get it recognized. Will work with Ring Alarm!

reviews.productTitle: Enbrighten Almond Z-Wave Plus Smart Light Switch with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, Toggle, 14293
reviews.text: "The switch is NOT a standalone device. it MUST be used with a Enbrighten smart control for z-wave, zigbee or bluetooth home automation. This 'info' should be front and center in the product description! Now it gets returned!! They really need to make a device that works with Alexa without the extra purchase of a HUB. I gave it 5 stars so people read about this! EDIT to add today I received an email explaining how to use the switch: "Get the Enbrighten app from Google Play Store or Apple App Store. Follow the steps to set up your device." I read the instructions and don't recall this being there. Had they included the above I might have tried the app!! No wonder it's the most returned item!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2024
reviews.title: MUST BUY AN ADDITIONAL 'HUB CONTROLLER' TO WORK

reviews.productTitle: Enbrighten Almond Z-Wave Plus Smart Light Switch with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, Toggle, 14293
reviews.text: I purchased 20 of these as I wanted to replace many of the switches in my house. Most of my current switches are 3-way so I thought it would be ideal. Unfortunately after spending many hours wiring them in, every 3-way in my house did not work. These seem to work fine as a single switch, but I bought these because of the 3-way passthrough.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2024
reviews.title: Not a 3 way switch

reviews.productTitle: Enbrighten Almond Z-Wave Plus Smart Light Switch with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, Toggle, 14293
reviews.text: I was one of those people who thought that anything returned to Amazon actually went to auction companies and they never touched it again. Apparently I am wrong because although I purchased a “new” unit, what I received could only be described as “open box.” To get to the point regarding the switch, the directions are clear and I had it integrated into my home Zwave network in a few minutes - and it works. It identified as a GE brand during installation (on my hub). No issues yet. I probably would have rated it 5-stars if the packaging was factory-sealed. I completely overlooked this in the description - this switch doesn’t illuminate when it’s in the off position like some others that I own do. So if this is important to you, consider a different make possibly.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2024
reviews.title: New to me but it works

reviews.productTitle: Enbrighten Almond Z-Wave Plus Smart Light Switch with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, Toggle, 14293
reviews.text: I'm not sure why anyone is not giving these a great review. Nor do I understand why they are a "Frequently returned item". They work. They connect to my SmartThings hub. I can control my lights. A couple of notes: 1) The model I bought is not a dimmer - just on and off - I knew that when I ordered them and they do just that 2) They are supposed to be able to sense the "in" and "out" - I had to fiddle with the wires and swap the "in" and "out" connections - it took 5 minutes. They fit in the switch box - keep in mind that ALL smart switches are bigger than a simple switch - you might have to push the wires around to make it fit. To be clear, neither of these caused any issue and are quickly handled.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2024
reviews.title: Works well

reviews.productTitle: Enbrighten Almond Z-Wave Plus Smart Light Switch with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, Toggle, 14293
reviews.text: The switch I received has a sticker identifying it as a refurb even though I ordered a new item at the same price as a new item. The package had obviously been resealed. This is misrepresentation - if I’m getting a refurb, it should be declared and priced accordingly.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2024
reviews.title: Was sent a refurb even though I ordered a new item

So you never know on reliability. Update: Recent storm blew out four of these. This time around they were a total PITA to get connected to Smartthings. Finally got them all connected after over an hour of pairing attempts, un-pairing and restating Smartthings app.

reviews.productTitle: Enbrighten Almond Z-Wave Plus Smart Light Switch with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, Toggle, 14293
reviews.text: I am generally happy with JASCO products (they made products for GE and now under Enbrighten brand. While this is not too desired color and went on sale, I installed multiple in basement, garage and out-of-sight locations. It has smaller form factor so it fits easier into tight boxes. Only complaint I have that it doesn't have any status LED which I would find very useful. Also pairing was a bit problematic, I had to reset, pair, reset, pair, but eventually it went nicely with S2 security. (It may be fault of Home Assistant or unit, can't tell)
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.title: Good device, works flawlessly with Home Assistant

reviews.productTitle: Enbrighten Almond Z-Wave Plus Smart Light Switch with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, Toggle, 14293
reviews.text: Switch works great. Integrated perfectly in my Ring Alarm z-wave setup. Integrated immediately into Alexa with no further configuration. Switch response to Alexa voice commands is almost instantaneous versus my WeMo plugs that have a second or two delay. No flicker at all on two 75W equivalent LED bulbs that are in a fan. This was for lights on a year 2000 fan with separate light and fan speed switches, so I was able to automate the light switch. I can see from some other reviews here that the switches don't last. I'll report back if that happens to me.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2022
reviews.title: Initial setup went well. Speedy switching.

reviews.productTitle: Enbrighten Almond Z-Wave Plus Smart Light Switch with QuickFit and SimpleWire, 3-Way Ready, Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, Toggle, 14293
reviews.text: I have successfully installed this device and have it incorporated into my "smart home" network. It SHOULD NOT be called "3-way" in the technical information if it can't work with a conventional 3-way switch and required a special additional switch which isn't clearly identified. The printed installation instructions use such a small font they are EXTREMELY difficult to read. Hidden in the instructions is a disclaimer that the switch can be permanently damaged if used with a conventional 3-way switch installation instead of their special products.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2021
reviews.title: Poor Product Description

I'm sending it back. It doesn't make sense to spend $160 for a light switch.
